alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 21 at 3:19PM EST until February 23 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Rain combined with warm temperatures will increase snowmelt and runoff into area streams and rivers Tuesday night and Wednesday. This will lead to river rises and possible ice movement. Ice may jam due to recent recharging and refreezing. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt and/or ice jam is possible. * WHERE...Portions of western Maine, including the following areas, Northern Oxford and Southern Oxford. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Northern Carroll, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Carroll, Southern Coos, Southern Grafton and Sullivan. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Sullivan
